titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Moody Chase (1802-1879) was born in Cornish, New Hampshire. He graduated from Kimball Academy, Dartmouth Theological Academy, and Andover Theological Seminary. He served as pastor at the Fairview United Presbyterian Church in Fairview, Ohio. His wife was Hannah Jewett Chase.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Moody Chase. Materials include: a journal, 1830-1831, of notes and extracts from lectures at seminary, some given by Dr. Woods; and undated photographs of Chase and his wife, Hannah. The collection also contains several published volumes, including Brown's Concordance (1832), Pious Reflections by Fenelon, the Book of Common Prayer, and a hymnal.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
